Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Cemented and Uncemented Hemiarthroplasty for Displaced Femoral Neck Fractures in the Elderly

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either a cemented implant (n=112) or an uncemented, hydroxyapatite-coated implant (n=108)

Participants.evidence: patients aged 70 years and older with displaced femoral neck fractures at [study setting]

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either a cemented implant (n=112) or an uncemented, hydroxyapatite-coated implant (n=108)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the mean Harris hip score at 3 and 12 months post-surgery

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed

Blinding.evidence: Outcome assessors were blinded to group assignments

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 220 participants were randomised between January 2020 and June 2021

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis was conducted using an intention-to-treat approach

Result_Outcome.evidence: The mean Harris hip score showed equivalence between groups: 70.9 in the cemented group and 72.1 in the uncemented group at 3 months (mean difference, 1.2) and 78.9 and 79.8 at 12 months (mean difference, 0.9)

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were reported in [number/percentage] of participants in each group, with no significant differences in frequency or severity
